awd_titl_txt: Particle and Quantum Field Theory Investigations
awd_abstract_narration: Theoretical research in elementary particle physics and                    quantum field theory will focus on predicting the higher -order                 effects of the weak interaction, and on the question of why                     quarks and gluons are always confined within larger particles.                  New experimental facilities at the European Laboratory for                      Particle Physics (CERN), the Fermi National Accelerator                         Laboratory, and the Stanford Linear Accelerator Center, have                    made possible incisive tests of our theory of the weak                          interaction which center on the higher - order effects                          predicted by this theory.  These tests are a major thrust of                    current efforts in particle physics.  The question of why                       quarks and gluons are confined is a long - standing one which                   is difficult to answer because it concerns phenomena in which                   the strong nuclear force cannot be treated as a small                           perturbation.  Progress on the answer to this question is                       important if we are to fully comprehend the strong force.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
